categories.name: Sales Track Record
categories.criteria: Proven revenue growth, large/complex deals, turnaround experience. Clear metrics on ARR, ACV, cycle, stakeholders.
sample_questions: Walk me through your most significant revenue growth achievement. What was the starting ARR/booking number, what did you grow it to, and over what time period?
Tell me about your largest deal or set of deals closed — what was the ACV, sales cycle, and how many stakeholders were involved?
Describe a time you turned around an underperforming territory, team, or product line. What metrics improved and by how much?

categories.name: Leadership & Team Building
categories.criteria: Built or scaled sales teams from scratch; hiring bar, performance management, and team outcomes.
sample_questions: How many times have you built or scaled a sales team from scratch or near-scratch? What was the starting size and what did you grow it to?
Walk me through your hiring process for sales roles — what scorecard or interview stages do you use to ensure A-player hires?
Tell me about a time you had to deal with consistent underperformance on the team. How did you handle it and what was the result?

categories.name: Strategic Thinking & GTM Execution
categories.criteria: Owned GTM strategy, forecasting, and adaptation to market/competitive changes.
sample_questions: Describe a complete GTM strategy you owned and executed — what market, positioning, channels, and metrics did you target?
How do you build and maintain an accurate sales forecast? Walk me through your current model and a time it helped or failed.
Tell me about a time the market or competitive landscape changed dramatically — how did you adapt the sales motion?

categories.name: Coaching & Development
categories.criteria: Coaching reps on deals, rep development metrics, pipeline and velocity improvement at team level.
sample_questions: How do you coach reps on live deals? Give an example of a rep you took from average to top performer.
What key metrics do you track to measure rep development (e.g., ramp time, win rate improvement, promotion rate)?
Describe your approach to pipeline building and deal velocity improvement at the team level.

categories.name: Communication & Influence
categories.criteria: Ability to pitch, influence non-sales stakeholders, and deliver bad news to executives and team.
sample_questions: Present a 2-minute mock pitch for our product as if you were selling to a skeptical CRO.
Tell me about a time you had to influence a non-sales stakeholder (CEO, Product, Finance) to change direction.
How do you deliver bad news (missed quarter, lost deal) to executives and the team?

categories.name: Cultural Fit & Motivation
categories.criteria: Fit for stage, motivation beyond money, learning from failure.
sample_questions: Why do you want to join us specifically at this stage of the company?
What motivates you most beyond money — give an example of a time you stayed committed through difficulty.
Tell me about a professional failure or setback and what you learned from it.
